entry.title: 537: Unity Mutiny
entry.summary: Our unique take on the Unity outrage, thoughts on RustRover, and Mike shares a very annoying mistake.

entry.title: 529: Changing the Game
entry.summary: Even if you don't game, the data is in, and the impact of the Steam Deck on Linux is massive. We'll go into details and then share our long-term review of the Deck. Special Guests: Alex Kretzschmar and Listener Jeff.

entry.title: 536: Grindr-in-Chief
entry.summary: The painful side of making video games, Grinder's big problems, and Google's sneakiest trojan horse.

entry.title: 528: Where's Your Data?
entry.summary: Today's theme is data sovereignty, and we'll check in with two crucial projects that are giving you more options. Special Guest: Noah Chelliah.

entry.title: 535: Locally Sourced Carbon Neutral Consumer
entry.summary: Did Apple's event live up to our expectations? And our thoughts on what new goodies for developers might be in the new hardware and software.

entry.title: 527: Framing Brent
entry.summary: Brent's new Framework laptop has been torn apart and put back together again. We'll find out if it's up to his standards. Plus, we're kicking off a new build.

entry.title: 534: Blame the Automation
entry.summary: Azure suffers a big outage, and Microsoft blames faulty automation; why we think there might be early signs of weak demand for Apple's Vision Pro and more.

entry.title: 526: Canonical Wins by Default
entry.summary: While chaos is brewing in SUSE and Red Hat land, Canonical stays the course and doubles down on the Linux desktop. Plus, our thoughts on the kernel team GPL-blocking NVIDIA.
